document_title: Helicobacter pylori infection: Signs and treatment
subsection_name: nhiem-khuan-hp.json_4_Who should be tested for H. pylori?
subsection_content:
Diagnostic testing for H.p. infection will be considered in each of the following specific cases:
In people with symptoms
Dr. Thanh said, a diagnostic test for H. pylori infection should be performed if the patient is suffering from gastric/duodenal ulcers or has a history of ulcers.
Although H. pylori infection is the most common cause of ulcers, not all patients with ulcers have H. pylori. Some medications (eg aspirin, ibuprofen, naproxen, diclofenac...) can also cause duodenal ulcers.
In people without symptoms
Testing for H. pylori is usually not recommended for people who are asymptomatic and have no history of peptic ulcer disease.
However, it may be considered for selected people, such as those with a family history or concern about stomach cancer, especially those of Chinese, Korean, Japanese or Central America; These groups have a higher incidence of stomach cancer.
